page.title: 17Carnival and Fete.(contd).
page.content: { Indian Queens Band Carnival.24.7.85. A record entry and a large crowd made the Indian Queens Band Carnival a great success.Among the floats was one showing Queen Victoria and Prince Albert.They were driven by Mr.Ivan Kessell in his 1950 2.5 litre Riley. There were bands from St.Dennis,Bugle and Indian Queens and six troupes of majorettes.Queens Pantomime Society gave a preview of their 1986 show,Puss in Boots,complete with piano and costumes.Money rolled in to the collectors,one, a Mr.Netherton raising more than Â£46. {Best entry-}Old Woman who lived in a Shoe. {Best tableau-}Birds Eye Kids (Fraddon) {Best adult entry -}Gnomes. {Best child entry -}Matchstick Boy.
